intro: Asterostoma aspera, commonly known as the rough asterostoma, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It is native to regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Asterostoma aspera is often found in open grasslands and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
